intro: Malleostemon nephroideus, commonly known as the kidneyleaf malleostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, kidney-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
